sentence.text: The younger affected sibling is a 21-year-old boy.
His height is 190 cm with a head circumference of 55 cm (98th percentile and 40th percentile, respectively).
He was born after a full-term spontaneous pregnancy.
Polyhydramnios was detected during the pregnancy.
Delivery was normal (vaginal), and the various birth parameters including weight, height, and head circumference were reported to be normal.
His clinical course and disease manifestations were very similar to his elder sister, including epilepsy.
Additionally, he had a cleft lip and cleft palate, which were not present in his sister.
He received speech therapy, physiotherapy, and occupational therapy.
He had moderate intellectual disabilities and attended a special education class.
The chest X-ray report indicated the presence of bilateral bifid and fused ribs, as well as hemivertebrae for the T1 and T2 thoracic vertebrae.
